website_summaries.verdict: This is a seafood mallet rather than a workshop mallet. It's effective at what it's designed for, and the price is low.
cons: Not as versatile as other wood mallets
more for the kitchen than the workshop

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The ridges are so low that you have to squeeze your hand very hard to crack the nut. The higher the nut is placed at the top, the easier it is to crack. The lower the nut is, you have to use more force to crack the nut. After cracking and eating nuts, my hand was sore. (My old nutcracker broke.) Maybe this is good for seafood, but not nuts. (It said it is for seafood and nuts). I'll try it for seafood, but I'll have to but another nutcracker for nuts only. That's what I get for trying to buy something for dual usage.
customer_reviews.author: Swanee Lane

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Seafood Wooden Crab Mallet - TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Despite what the product description says, this is only 7-1/4 inches long and the head of the mallet is only 1-1/4 inches diameter and 2-1/2 inches wide. It's much too small for a general purpose kitchen mallet, and I don't know that I'd try it with seafood either. What saves it is that I RECEIVED AN IMMEDIATE REFUND WITHOUT THE HASSLE OF HAVING TO RETURN IT, THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: MJ Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive description - Mallet is only 7.25 inches long, not 9.5
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mallet because it said it was 9.5 inches, longer than the others advertised on Amazon. The others are 7.25 inches and way too short to be used effectively. So really really unhappy to get these and find out they are the same size, not the 9.5 inches they state they.
customer_reviews.author: Twink

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I didn't read all the details but this is much smaller than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: St. Steven

customer_reviews.title: Tool Cuts Well, but Retaining Clip is Not Durable Enough
customer_reviews.text: Tool cuts seafood shells well, but the problem is that the flanges on red plastic clip in the middle of the tool that hold it closed break after a couple of uses. I have purchased this tool twice, as the first time I thought it broke because I was too hard on it, so I bought it again taking care to use it carefully, and I still had the same problem with the clip breaking after just a couple of uses. Tool works well otherwise, I hope they re-design this part.
customer_reviews.author: chancshii

customer_reviews.title: Great shears. Terrible latch.
customer_reviews.text: I've read the reviews regarding the red latch breaking off so I figured I'll just be extra careful. Went to a seafood buffet with all you can eat king crab and the second leg in the plastic latch broke. It's located in a position that is bound to get in the way. The shears itself worked great. If I were inclined to get another one I'd look into the possibility of taking the latch off before using. The latch is a flimsy plastic piece so bring along a rubber band to hold the shears close in case the latch breaks anyway no matter what you do.
customer_reviews.author: MrVu

customer_reviews.title: Makes eating crab legs even more fun
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. Only problem is the latch for holding them closed. Poorly designed and located so it broke on first use. I hold them shut with a rubber band for storage. They should improve the design. On the plus side, this has made eating crab legs and lobsters a whole lot easier and less messy. I'd recommend it, but have a rubber band handy.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Holden

customer_reviews.title: Great little brab breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Small crab legs masher that packs apunch no more broken teeth. Good solid wooden smasher.
customer_reviews.author: daniel espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, light, little wooden hammer makes an excellent Midsommar prop.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a Midsommar costume, and it was perfect. Dipped one end in some fake blood and voila! It killed (bah-dum, tssh). I don't know what its actual use is. Something abouy hitting seafood before you eat it? I'm sure it would be good for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love these, great for cracking crab shells, unfortunately I can't bring it to my favorite seafood restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: KTran

customer_reviews.title: False description!
customer_reviews.text: The Web site claimed this product was 9 1/2 inches long, in reality it is only 7 1/2 inches long as you can see in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Seafood Picks are great little tools.
customer_reviews.text: These forks were just what I've needed to supplement the seafood tools I already had. I am a lobster lover and will not waste a single morsel of the little claws. These help me get it all. In addition, I find these are really helpful for getting olives or pickles out of their jars. They are great little tools for just a small expense.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customert

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: The blade on this knife came out of the handle the first time we used it, it is not sturdy enough to shuck clams.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: We go crabbing often in the Pacific Northwest, so ...
customer_reviews.text: We go crabbing often in the Pacific Northwest, so we really needed some utensils to get at that delicious meat. The set of seafood forks we bought from Farberware arrived swiftly and met all of our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of a job I've never liked but perform 2-3 times a month
customer_reviews.text: Makes quick work of a job I've never liked but perform 2-3 times a month. It does take some pressure to get it started through the shell, so be careful of the fingers holding the shrimp.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ryan

customer_reviews.title: tooo small
customer_reviews.text: toooooo small.......missed the return window........ i should have read the reviews measurements misleading.....looks like a child's toy
customer_reviews.author: LI mom

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: It is a third the size I expected. Read description carefully before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: andy howington

customer_reviews.title: good but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This deveiner does what it is supposed to do. It is sharp. When using it on the black vein on the back of the shrimp the curved point penetrates deeper that I feel like it should, certainly deeper than the plastic deveiners do. However, that same point is very useful it removing the smaller vein on the bottom of the shrimp.
customer_reviews.author: Jbdozier

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: Was thinking this would have been a little bigger and heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good shears, retainer clip breaks
customer_reviews.text: Really like the lobster shears but the retaining clip (shown in red on the photo) immediately broke on 2 out of 3 the shears. While not a big deal, if you put a "feature" on a product it should work
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift house really enjoyed using it
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Flocco

customer_reviews.title: Great for Garlic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mallet to crush my garlic and it does the job very well. High quality, perfect size, and no more time wasted trying to peel the thin skin off my bulbs. Recommend highly for this purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Works WELL
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I give it five stars compared to other products. It does the job quickly, with minimum strokes. It's not foolproof-automatic. You still have to pick at the vein some. But it fast and sharp and shaped properly.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C.

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: This item came very poorly packaged as it was already open and falling out of the box, I also expected it to be a bit bigger but its not a problem really. Decent quality for the price so I have no complaints on that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Simplifies eating lobsters
customer_reviews.text: These strong, good-grip lobster shears make it easy to break through the lobster claws, even big tough ones. Helps keep lobster-eating mess to a minimum. I have recommended these shears to others.
customer_reviews.author: Karsteph

customer_reviews.title: nice little mallet - good heft
customer_reviews.text: POW! nice little mallet - good heft, works well to crack crab or crush ice - well made, good size, and nice finicsh on the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Keyser Soze

customer_reviews.title: watched 2 youtube videos and I was shucking like a pro
customer_reviews.text: This is the knife to get. I never shucked a clam in my life. I bought this knife, watched 2 youtube videos and I was shucking like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Great function at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy; they didn't bend at all after being used at two charity crab feeds and you can't even tell they've been through the dishwasher (in the basket, of course.)
customer_reviews.author: L. Pirlot

customer_reviews.title: These work great in getting out all the
customer_reviews.text: just in time - never can just snap and eat those crab legs! These work great in getting out all the meat
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Operator error.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I used it correctly. Should come with an instruction sheet. Deveining for dummies. Easier to use a paring knife.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B

customer_reviews.title: cool mallet
customer_reviews.text: You need a mallet to crack hard shells and make a lot of noise while you are eating Lobstah...part of a great Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.author: juliecooly

customer_reviews.title: OK, like them
customer_reviews.text: they work, but are a bit too lightweight. Price was right though
customer_reviews.author: count Florida

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, high quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to find this product for home use after using a similar implement in a restaurant.The quality is excellent! The design makes it so easy to remove the lucious crab from the claws without shredding it. I would recommend this product to anyone who enjoys eating seafood at home.
customer_reviews.author: TideDawg

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to use with pistachios. Works quite well for those stubborn, hard-to-open shells.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Critic

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Actually I use it on my bar to break one or two ice cubes for mixed drinks. Works fine. For my use.. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: SgtRick

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: They are attractive, a nice weight and length. They blend with most silverware and are dishwasher safe. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the size I expected
customer_reviews.text: This product has a good quality, just very small. I was expecting it to be 30 to 40% larger. Good for smaller crab legs.
customer_reviews.author: MT Amini

customer_reviews.title: When you see a fork in the road.........
customer_reviews.text: Great little forks. The quality of these forks is comparable with what i get in most restaurants so I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hoxey

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed. The description indicated forks were sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The description indicated forks were sturdy. They are very small and not made of of heavy materials. I would not order them again--- do not compare quality wise to forks found at crate and barrel.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE on back of package:
customer_reviews.text: 1. Remove the head of the shrimp. 2. Hold each shrimp with its tail facing down. 3. Insert the deveiner under and along the back of the shrimp shell, with the deveiner's cutting edge facing up and notched edge facing down. 4. Push the deveiner downward toward the tail, cutting the shell through the end of the tail; this will remove the vein. 5. Remove all traces of the vein by washing the shrimp thoroughly in cold water.
customer_reviews.author: KCMO

customer_reviews.title: its very practical!
customer_reviews.text: i use this all the time for many things like; fruits, escargot, lobsters etc. Cleans good and its nice looking
customer_reviews.author: M. E. cival

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a second set of 4 of these seafood picks to ensure that I'll have enough for an upcoming party After trying the first set, I was surprised at how durable these are...even with the roughest of handling they looked as good as new. I'm happy with the selection and glad to add them to the array of serve ware that I have for those occasions when I need them. I do recommend these without question.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Priest

customer_reviews.title: Great for crabs
customer_reviews.text: So much better than having to eat crabs whole. Also Chef's Secret---Cook the crabs before you have to eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: No squabbles here!! It does exactly what it's suppose to do. I had one of these back in the day and it is well worth having at a great price as well!
customer_reviews.author: bbb2

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through shells real good but the red clamp breaks so easy
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through shells real good but the red clamp breaks so easy. I bought another one of these off line and the same thing happened so I use a thick rubber band to keep them closed when not using them. Both times the red slider broke the first time I used them. Seems like the company should use something stronger.
customer_reviews.author: DENISE D FARINACCI

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Five lobsters were no match for three Faberware Seafood Lobster Shears.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N Cross

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The Item was too small and not heavy enough too small. Did not work as expected to crack crab legs.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Broke second time time I used them. The did, however, cut beautifully. The thing that holds it together broke.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Watson

customer_reviews.title: Best Seafood Tool
customer_reviews.text: We eat a fair bit of seafood and if you are looking to invest in seafood tools, I recommend you start with these.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Collins

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The only thing I didn't like is that the split ends bend some when used.
customer_reviews.author: Lolita S.

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: We finally sat down to our long awaited lobster dinner. My husband started cutting and said "wow these are great!" Then they fell apart and after dinner, my husband started trying to fix them. That was 2 hours ago without any success I just read where it's too late to return them or have them replaced. What a shame
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: stainless steel...don't bend like other cheap versions. Perfect for extracting all that hard to get crab and lobster meat. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: sleuthone

customer_reviews.title: Good Crap Cruncher
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Was too light weight for our needs but good for crab crunchin'
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: And very cheap metal. Don't bother buying these. Spend a little more and get something you actually want to stick in your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product was smaller than expected. Lightweight and almost can't hold larger nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife. I use it as a butter knife. My husband wants one for clams. Sharp enough for clams. I keep our butter out and previously used a clam knife because of the length and the width of the blade. I think its perfect for my needs and husbands.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L

customer_reviews.title: Tiny mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny wood mallet. I don’t eat crab so I am not sure how big these things are supposed to be. Lol. But I was expecting a heavy duty big wooden mallet. It was my mistake to have never looked at the measurements before I purchased. I am keeping it since it could be used for other applications. I needed a mallet to tenderize cabbage sprinkled with salt to make fermented cabbage/sauerkraut. This tiny mallet won’t work at all. Oh well. Wasn’t that expensive, so I will keep it. On a search for the same look mallet, but a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: ezs

customer_reviews.title: Really lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a tapping aid, not for intended use. Works ok, but very lightweight so I should have paid more attention. Probably good for snow crab. Might be useful as a gavel for family court, lol
customer_reviews.author: S. Dyroff

customer_reviews.title: It's a wooden mallet...
customer_reviews.text: I did not buy this for cracking claws. I needed a small mallet for tapping my 3D Print removal tool between the print and the bed when the printing is done. I was using a wooden spoon, but this is much better. Perfect weight and control for the task. THink outside the box!
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great if you love crab!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I enjoy crab from time to time, and these picks were surprisingly effective. I was concerned that the small size of the forks would not be strong enough to bite through crab shells, but I was wrong! They just march right through the shell, although I would not necessarily recommend them for Alaskan King Crab. For that, I would suggest Sea Shellers. But these are wonderful for smaller crabs, such as Dungeness or Snow crab. They are great for getting that hard-to-reach crab meat in the claws and clusters.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tasteful

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot smaller and lighter than I expected, but I'm hoping it will work for my purposes to break up ramen noodles.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Geier

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until they broke
customer_reviews.text: First time we used these, we LOVED them. They were awesome. So sharp, cut through crab and lobster shells like butter. Second time we used them, they broke. That little red piece that holds the blades together when you're not using them snapped off. In the trash they went. Was very disappointed. Had high hopes for years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Clare C

customer_reviews.title: Nice, a Bit Smaller Than Expected, But Nice Finish
customer_reviews.text: I think the Alaskan King Crab might remain intact with this one, but the gentle tapping or smashing, this will do nicely. I keep a slightly larger, and weightier shop mallet--has never see the outside of my kitchen--in tandem with this wood one for ultimate flexibility!
customer_reviews.author: North Texas Scout

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight and did a great job. We used it to break crab claws.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Mulholland

customer_reviews.title: Wrong dimensions in description - mallet is only 7 1/4 inches long
customer_reviews.text: Description states that mallet is 9.5 inches long which is false. In fact the packaging is 9.5 inches long and the mallet itself only about 7 1/4 inches long, incl. the head. I wanted a mallet to crack ice cubes in a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Dont know about cracking crabs but... I Used this to make a canning jar packer...and it works excellent for that purpose. good dense grained wood...very solid and hefty for its size.
customer_reviews.author: MantisRain

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: Wow - I ordered two of these things and it looks like they were hand rivoted at the pivot point by an eighty year old. One swings very free and the other may need some oil (or butter) and may also require a break-in period so it will pivot.
customer_reviews.author: N. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Dig In
customer_reviews.text: Look out crab legs here I come! These are great with a fork at one end and a scoop at the other. The length is perfect too, not too long or too short. They feel nice and solid too.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Holle

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Garbage....this broke on the first use. I want to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Liljequist

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a 20 year old classic with this
customer_reviews.text: Had the same plastic deveiner for 20 years, loved it for its history but the new deveiner is about 20 times faster and it strips the sand vein normally in one motion. The quality of the handle and "blade" is excellent. Only thing you need to be careful of is to keep your forefinger away from the tail of the shrimp or if not there is a slight chance you could cut yourself if the deveiner had a lot of force on it when it breaks through the shell. But overall a huge leap forward in functionality. Bought a second one for my beach house. McG
customer_reviews.author: Fair and Balanced

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: Used these many times cutting lobsters at a previous job. Finally found a pair for my chef kit for work and my home. Watch out im cutting lobsters!
customer_reviews.author: liltrixter

customer_reviews.title: How can you enjoy lobster without these gems
customer_reviews.text: How can you enjoy lobster without these gems? Great quality, great price, these beauties will fit the bill for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: PAF

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: They were smaller than I thought - good for picking the last pieces but laborious to eat any significant parts.
customer_reviews.author: Nike's mom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. I use it for woodworking with small ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I use it for woodworking with small chisels and I love the feel. Mine will never see a crab shell. Good product and great service.
customer_reviews.author: DRM Racing

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Seafood Deveiner
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I like this item or not. I have tried using it a couple of times but don't feel I have learn how to yet. I need to go on YouTube to see if I can find a video on how to use this tool. I will say it is very sharp and you have to be careful not to cut yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Grammyez

customer_reviews.title: Cut shell effectively.. but.. red clip locks broke in minutes of regular use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two and one of the red clip locks broke in minutes of regular use. Since I rarely need them I kept the unlock-able pair secured in the closed position with a rubber band. They do cut shell very effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Spiracles

customer_reviews.title: These forks get the job done. They are just ...
customer_reviews.text: These forks get the job done. They are just the right size for extracting all of the crab claw meat.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: useful tools. Arrived on time as scheduled
customer_reviews.text: Products as described, useful tools. Arrived on time as scheduled.
customer_reviews.author: Bev  R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Picks
customer_reviews.text: These are good seafood picks for any shellfish, such as crab legs and lobster, etc. They are narrow so they get into most small areas, which is why you need them in the first place, but they are also not bent. This is a good thing because if this tool is bent, usually at the spoon end, it can be maneuvered into fewer spots, which can be frustrating! These are good, simple picks that do their job.
customer_reviews.author: JapaRider

customer_reviews.title: They do what they're supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I should start this review by saying that i don't put these through the dishwasher so i can't tell you how they'll hold up. The shipping was quick and they're as described.
customer_reviews.author: E. Harm

customer_reviews.title: seem awful small
customer_reviews.text: more like a 5 year old's mallet than something to be used with stone crabs. Sooo small, no heft. I'll try it but not sure if the claw won't break this mallet.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Lobster shear easy eat
customer_reviews.text: cuts through claws and tail easy making it much easier to eat and enjoy , I would recommend this to anyone who loves to eat lobsters
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seafood picks
customer_reviews.text: They seem flimsy but they work really well. I hope they last for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Just take the time to learn it. Easy to clean. I used to use kitchen shears, but this is smaller, and deveins/peels in one motion.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Seafood picks
customer_reviews.text: These are somewhat better than your average run of the mill picks. Not light weight but, sturdy. I would recommend these asa an add on to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D. Mullenax

customer_reviews.title: Shrimp De Viener
customer_reviews.text: Makes it so much easier to clean shrimp fast. You put the tip in under the back and in one movement the shell comes off and the shrimp is open to de vein it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Ayon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a well invented tool for cracking nuts. The set is a great tool to have handy when the holidays come. Or when the nuts fall from the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly296

customer_reviews.title: Great Seafood Picks!
customer_reviews.text: Well bulit and did not bend when we used it to pick out all the meat while feasting on two dunguness crabs!
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: If you eat lobster, you need these
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these to the much more expensive all metal lobster shears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right length
customer_reviews.text: Right length and works. Used so far easily and successfully on some really big crab claws. Would not now choose a shorter handle.
customer_reviews.author: Colin McNamee

customer_reviews.title: YAY!
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to start making out Crab/Lobster at home (cost wise) and these do the job as described. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: strong enough to do the job
customer_reviews.text: These double ended seafood picks really do a nice job of getting the crab meat . Thought maybe they were be cheap but not so and do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Seafood Picks
customer_reviews.text: We really like these picks for cleaning our crab, little nooks that are difficult to get to can be reached with these picks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: its okay
customer_reviews.text: Kinda thinner than what I was expecting, and it feels very cheap. Not sure if I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Not good for nuts
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try using it for seafood, but it didn't do well with nuts. It bent out of shape while cracking a pecan.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Brogan

product_meta.title: Farberware Seafood Wooden Crab Mallet
product_meta.description: Style Name:Wooden Crab MalletThe Farberware Seafood Wooden Crab Mallet is an essential tool for any seafood lover. The mallet is designed to crack shells without shattering them. The mallet is constructed entirely of durable, moisture-resistant wood. The mallet is the perfect tool for opening lobster and crabs. The mallet measures 9-1/2 inches long. This product is completely dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: The mallet is designed to crack shells without shattering them.
The mallet is constructed entirely of durable, moisture-resistant wood.
The mallet is the perfect tool for opening lobster and crabs.
This product is completely dishwasher safe for fast and easy cleanup.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars205 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
